title: Font for fiscal cash register
content:
Can anyone tell help me with questions regarding to making font for fiscal cash register?

What final file format is used for FCR (fiscal cash registers)? TTF/OTF or some others (I found CFN and PWS formats also).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140412135820im_/http:/typophile.com/files/detalj_5062.jpg)

THANKS for any kind of help!
author: nettoo

comments.content: I also found some PDB file format. It looks like every manufactor have his own file format for their devices?

I'm sure that they look the way they do because older ones, at least, only supported bitmap fonts. That would suggest that it's not TTF or OTF. That said, there may be modern cash registers that are more powerful.

You could probably call a cash register company if you don't get an answer here.

Thanks Thomas, I'll do. That's the safest way.

It seems, like with same applications for different brands of mobile phones, that every manufactor do things on his own way.

Looks like this thread has become Spam Central…

_Can anyone tell help me with questions regarding to making font for fiscal cash register?_

I often find that the direct approach works best: how about contacting the manufacturer and getting their specifications? They _ought_ to know what works with their product…
